meanings.definition: The act of officially declaring someone a saint in the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The canonization of Mother Teresa brought joy to many believers.
meanings.sent2: The canonization ceremony was attended by thousands of faithful followers.
meanings.sent3: During the canonization, the saints in heaven must have had a big celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her selfless acts led to her canonization as a saint in the church.
meanings.sent5: The canonization process involves thorough investigation and divine approval.

meanings.definition: The process of determining which books are included in the biblical canon.
meanings.sent1: Scholars study ancient texts to understand the canonization of the Bible.
meanings.sent2: The canonization of the New Testament took centuries to complete.
meanings.sent3: The debate over canonization can get quite intense among theologians.
meanings.sent4: The canonization of certain books was controversial in early Christianity.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the canonization of scriptures requires historical context.

meanings.definition: The act of establishing a set of principles or rules as authoritative or accepted.
meanings.sent1: The canonization of laws is crucial for a just society.
meanings.sent2: In science, the canonization of theories is based on evidence.
meanings.sent3: The canonization of fashion trends can be unpredictable.
meanings.sent4: His work led to the canonization of new standards in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The canonization of traditions ensures cultural continuity.
